review: I read reviews for Chromecast/Roku/Amazon Firestick for hours before deciding that the Chromecast would meet my needs.  It worked just fine at first, with the caveat that, if I connected through my computer, any work done on my computer would make the picture delayed and choppy.  Less than a week later, and the Chromecast device is no longer detected by my phone (which is the only way I can really use this while using my computer at the same time, as explained above).  I checked the device, I unplugged/plugged in again, I've tried connecting a dozen times, and nothing.  Chromecast appears to be connected on the TV monitor, but through my phone, nothing.  The Chromecast works when I do it through my computer, but why would I want to watch a jilted TV show?  The "using your phone as a remote" thing is an impediment, not a benefit.  I'll give this thing a few more tries before I give up completely, but at this rate, it seems like I'll be returning this semi-functional device for something with its own remote that doesn't depend on another piece of technology.
